definition: The horizontal angle measured clockwise from the CRS meridian to the observed vector
The acute horizontal angle measured from a reference vector to the observed vector
The horizontal angle measured clockwise from any reference meridian to the observed vector
The vertical angle measured from the horizontal plane to the observed vector
The mean of the forward azimuth at the start of the line and the reverse azimuth at the end of the line
A subtended angle is an angle formed by two lines, or line segments that originate from the same point and extend to two different points on a circle's circumference.
